page.title: 02Shillington 2
page.content:
Both Church and village are often described as "a mother hen with her chicks." Aerial photographs certainly confirm this description, but Shillington is more than just that. Its 'Ends' stretch out to the borders of the surrounding villages. Apsley End, Bury End, Upton End, Hillfoot End and Hanscombe End are to be found today; others such as Duck End and Frogmore End have disappeared.
These outlying areas incorporate the agricultural aspect of village life; farmers from old village families like the Simkins and the Jepps whose grandfathers and great-grandfathers have ploughed Shillington's heavy clay soil before them.
